slides.content:
# Data Storytelling ğŸ“–

Turning data into compelling narratives.

## Definition

Data storytelling combines:
- Data
- Visuals
- Narrative

## Why Stories?

- Stories are memorable (22x more than facts)
- Drive action
- Create emotional connection
- Simplify complexity

> ğŸ’¡ Facts tell, stories sell!

slides.title: Story Structure
slides.content:
# Story Structure ğŸ“

## The Arc

1. **Setup** - Context, baseline
2. **Conflict** - The problem
3. **Resolution** - The insight/recommendation

## Presentation Flow

1. Hook (capture attention)
2. Context (background)
3. Insights (the meat)
4. Recommendation (so what?)
5. Call to action

## Key Elements

| Element | Purpose |
|---------|--------|
| Characters | Who cares? |
| Setting | Where/when? |
| Conflict | What's the problem? |
| Resolution | What's the answer? |

> ğŸ¯ Structure guides understanding!

slides.title: Structure Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What should come LAST in a data story presentation?

slides.title: Know Your Audience
slides.content:
# Know Your Audience ğŸ¯

## Questions to Ask

- What do they care about?
- What do they know already?
- What decisions will they make?
- What's their attention span?

## Audience Types

| Audience | Prefer |
|----------|--------|
| Executives | High-level, action-focused |
| Analysts | Details, methodology |
| General | Simple, visual |

## Adapt Your Story

- **Executives:** Lead with conclusion
- **Technical:** Include methodology
- **General:** More visuals, less jargon

> ğŸ’¡ Tailor your story to the audience!

slides.title: Visual Narrative
slides.content:
# Visual Narrative Techniques ğŸ¨

## Guide the Eye

- Use color to highlight
- Annotations for context
- Progressive reveal

## Show, Don't Tell

- Let visuals do the work
- Minimize text
- One message per visual

## Emphasis Techniques

- Bold colors for key data
- Grey out less important
- Size encodes importance
- Annotations explain

> ğŸ¯ Direct attention to insights!

slides.quizQuestion: To highlight key data, you should:
quizOptions: Use bold colors and grey out rest
